Events that occurred on 19 March

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1884 - Philologist Elias Lönnrot, who compiled the Kalevala, dies.
1918 - J.R.R. Tolkien attends a medical board examination. 9th Royal Defence Corps at Easington is disbanded and Tolkien is to be based at Thirtle Bridge again.
1956 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 185.
1989 - Heren Hyarmen is founded by Ronald Kyrmse in São Paulo, Brazil. On 9 January 2003, the name was changed to "Heren Hyarmeno", the correct Quenya genitive to mean "Order of the South".
2000 - Voice actor Fraser Kerr dies.
2013 - La Conexion Española de J.R.R. Tolkien is published in Spain.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 2510:
Borondir is on his way in search of the Éothéod.
T.A. 3019:
The Host of the West reaches the Morgul Vale. The Infantry joins Cavalry.
Frodo and Samwise escape the Orcs and begin their journey along the road to Barad-dûr.
